docs.lead_paragraph: Judge Mary S. Scriven of the United States District Court in Orlando held that the testing requirement violated the constitutional protection against unreasonable searches.

headline.main: Florida Law on Drug Tests for Welfare Is Struck Down
headline.print_headline: Florida Law On Drug Tests For Welfare Is Struck Down

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Mary S Scriven strikes down as unconstitutional Florida law that required welfare applicants to undergo mandatory drug testing, setting the stage for a legal battle that could affect similar efforts nationwide; holds that the testing requirement violated the constitutional protection against unreasonable searches.
docs.snippet: Judge Mary S. Scriven of the United States District Court in Orlando held that the testing requirement violated the constitutional protection against unreasonable searches.
